text: the senior prom is an American rite of
passage whatever happened at your prom
it probably was neither as magical nor
as horrifying as what happened to Carrie
white and Brian De Palma's film adapted
from a Stephen King novel of the same
name Carrie is like the combination of
an after-school special and a horror
movie it's about a misfit teenager
abused and teased and harassed by her
classmates who thanks to her telekinetic
powers exacts her bloody revenge but
Carrie is so much more than that
it's a grotesque scary comical
psychosexual tour-de-force
sometimes within the space of a single
seen the film pivots from b-movie
exploitation to profound and disturbing
insight and Brian DePalma is a master of
both none of the technical tricks or
stylistic flourishes feels at all
superfluous the feverish color scheme
matches the lurid themes why don't you
tell me ma the musical cues wittily
summon the ghost of Alfred Hitchcock and
together with the editing and the pacing
keeps us in a perpetual state of uneasy
suspense
and there's an artificial quality to the
camerawork that makes everything feel
more nightmarishly
there are some wonderful performances in
this film and also some that seem to
belong in a trashy horror movie there's
John Travolta in one of his very first
films Betty Buckley as the gym teacher
who takes care even in rolling there's a
weirdly spaced out Amy Irving as sue and
there's Piper Laurie in a frightening
and ghoulishly funny performance as
Carrie's mother a religious fanatic
obsessed with sexuality
the ball comes from there's something
extreme and violent in this woman's view
of the world and she projects it right
onto her daughter
and finally Spacek who is
nominated for an Academy Award in the
title role there's so much emotion in
this performance and the vulnerability
that Spacek effortlessly conveys
magnifies the cruelty of Carrie's
challenges gothic and extreme as it is
Carrie is fundamentally a coming-of-age
story Stephen King for all his
sensationalism has an acute
understanding of human psychology and
Carrie captures both the emotional
volatility of the world of female
adolescents and the terrifying power of
female sexuality this is not a simple
horror movie or revenge fantasy it's a
grand comic opera about innocence shame
and anger and it's exactly because
Carrie is so small so innocent so
helpless that her rage inspires such
